Wear a wide-brimmed hat: This is a classic solution that will provide full coverage for your head, protecting it from the sun's harmful rays. You can choose a hat that is lightweight, breathable, and comfortable to wear, such as a baseball cap or a fedora.
Use a scarf or bandana: You can wear a scarf or bandana around your head to protect it from the sun. You can choose a lightweight and breathable material that will keep you cool in the heat.

Use sunscreen: You can apply sunscreen to your scalp before going outside to protect it from the sun's harmful rays. Choose a broad-spectrum sunscreen with at least SPF 30 and apply it to your scalp regularly.

Wear a wig or hairpiece: If you're looking for a more permanent solution, you can consider wearing a wig or hairpiece. This will provide full coverage for your head, protecting it from the sun's harmful rays.

Use a UV-protective visor: You can wear a UV-protective visor on top of your head to protect it from the sun's harmful rays. This will provide full coverage for your head and will also protect your eyes from harmful UV rays.
